title: Is writing an essay for money illegal? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: Not in and of itself, no. Someone with the requisite skills and qualifications could be asked - for example - to write an essay for a newspaper explaining a topical issue, whatever it may be. My university even has what they call the “experts list” for precisely this purpose, so that the various news sources we have can contact an expert in (let’s say) town planning to ask them about writing an article about a new train line or whether we need more green space, or whatever. I’m not sure that the pay is particularly great, mind you, but if money didn’t change hands I’d be surprised. It’s that same logic which has a lot of “essay writing services” indicating that they’re providing “example answers”, rather than actually doing your work for you. It’s not illegal for you to ask them “How should my essay about To Kill a Mockingbird look?”, and neither is it illegal for them to say “It should look like this attached file. Best of luck with your assignment.” Where things get murky, though, is when you take the “example answer” provided and say “This is my work. Honest it is.” You’ve still not broken the law, usually, but you’ve engaged in academic fraud, which will get you into as much trouble in an educational sense as breaking the law would in a criminal one.

Unless you are talking about something else, something specific like a questionable subject matter. Still, many people do even that, though I wouldn’t recommend it. Or perhaps you’are talking about writing an essay for another person who will pass it for his/her own. Something like another student. Something to be presented to some school authority etc. In which case it would be cheating on the part of the other person, and he/she could end up in trouble. But unless he involves you, and mention something about paying you, you might be accused of aiding in something dishonest. But generally speaking, I don’t see anything terribly wrong in you doing it for money, usually for a smallish amount. But, in my opinion, it would be better not to do it regularly.

Writing an essay is certainly not illegal, for money or for fun (or for school, as the case may be, though in that case you would probably wish that it was illegal). Many people have written essays, or similar works, for money. These are often included in newspapers or magazines, or even online. There is nothing inherently wrong with this. Of course, there are ways where it could be bad. If you are paid to write an essay for a student so they do not have do any work, then you are being unethical. However, writing an essay for money is entirely legal as long as the proper people get the proper credit they deserve.

I assume you’re talking about essays to be submitted by a university student for credit. The problem is, “illegal” is not a straightforward concept. Submitting a plagiarized essay is a kind of fraud, and definitely a breach of the contract between the student and the university. If you *help* someone commit fraud, or help someone breach a contract, you’re not exactly in the clear, legally. Now, it may be that you’ll get away with it. The university is more likely to be interested in the *student’s* behaviour, and less likely trying to get a court to punish the writer. (I’m not a lawyer, but that’s my guess.) Either way, writing essays for money is definitely unethical. It’s helping someone to lie, to cheat, and to take credit where credit has not been earned.
